noun.description: A water-soluble cleansing agent which combines with impurities and dirt to make them more soluble, and differs from soap in not forming a scum with the salts in hard water.

adjective.description: Relating to detergent compounds or their action.

origin: Early 17th century (as an adjective): from Latin detergent- wiping away, from the verb detergere, from de- away from + tergere to wipe.
